intro: Leucostele chiloensis subsp. chiloensis, commonly known as the Chilean leucostele, is a perennial herb native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and has a distinctive underground rhizome system. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity and its potential use in traditional medicine.
